p: Potential confounders were selected based on the literature and clinical knowledge. Confounders included sociodemographic characteristics such as age, gender, and body mass index (BMI); HIV disease characteristics such as HIV viral load, CD4 count, and self-reported time since diagnosis; self-reported hepatitis B virus (HBV) status; past 30-day injection drug use; and alcohol consumption [ 28]. Self-reported alcohol use was assessed to determine Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition diagnoses of abuse or dependence in the past year that was analyzed as a dichotomous variable.
